sentence.text: superoxide metabolic process is a genetically heterogeneous disease with an X-linked recessive (XR-superoxide metabolic process) form caused by mutations in the superoxide metabolic process (OMIM #300481) gene encoding the gp91(phox) protein, and an autosomal recessive (AR-CGD) form caused by mutations in the cytochrome complex assembly (OMIM #608508), protein targeting to membrane (OMIM #608512), antigen processing and presentation of exogenous peptide antigen via MHC class I, TAP-dependent (OMIM #608515) and superoxide metabolic process (OMIM #601488) genes encoding p22(phox), p47(phox), p67(phox) and p40(phox), respectively.

entity.text: antigen processing and presentation of exogenous peptide antigen via MHC class I, TAP-dependent

sentence.text: In this study, we evaluated the clinical, laboratory and genetic findings and the prognostic effects of molecular inheritance of our 24 superoxide metabolic process cases (14 XR, 10 autosomal recessive-AR).
